main.description: A resource which is useful to people or the ecosystem

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an item

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy for categorization

trackingIdentifier.description: Sometimes called serial number, used when each item must have a traceable identifier

image.description: The URI to an image relevant to the resource

imageList.description: URI addresses to images relevant to the resource

accountingQuantity.description: The current amount and unit for which the agent has primary rights and responsibilities

onhandQuantity.description: The current amount and unit which is under direct control of the agent

unitOfEffort.description: Reference to the Unit used for use or work or cite actions for this resource

containedIn.description: Used when a stock economic resource contains items also defined as economic resources

conformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource

primaryAccountable.description: The agent currently with primary rights and responsibilities for the economic resource

currentLocation.description: The current place an economic resource is located. Could be at any level of granularity.

stage.description: Reference to ProcessSpecification - the state of the desired economic resource

state.description: The state of the desired economic resource (pass or fail), after coming out of a test or review process

lot.description: Lot or batch of an economic resource, used to track forward or backwards to all occurrences
